data.title: Close Up ‚Äì A Cinematic Initiative for Non
data.meta_description: A Cinematic Initiative for Non-Fiction Filmmakers
data.text:
Close Up is a training, development, and mentorship program for documentary filmmakers from

Southwest Asia and North Africa.

Positioned at the intersection of arts, media, social change, and peace-building, Close Up is the only initiative of its kind in the region, creating a transformational experience for emerging filmmakers, coming from diverse ethnic, religious, cultural, and political backgrounds, including Afghanistan, Algeria, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bahrain, Egypt, Georgia, Iran, Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco, Oman, Palestine, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Sudan, Syria, Tunisia, Turkey, United Arab Emirates, Yemen.

Close Up was founded as a non-profit organization in Brussels, Belgium by five independent partners who collectively believe that working with emerging filmmakers from our region is essential to creating and maintaining cultural awareness and protecting our future. The partners include: Sigal Yehuda, Ahmet Boyacioglu, Bruni Burres, John Appel and Vincent Melilli.

üåü Huge News! We‚Äôre beyond thrilled to announce that No Other Land has been officially selected for the prestigious Telluride Film Festival! This will mark the North American premiere of this powerful documentary, and we couldn‚Äôt be more excited to share it on such an esteemed platform.

üéûÔ∏è Directed by our incredible Close Up fellows, Basel Adra, Yuval Abraham, Rachel Szor, and Hamdan Ballal from the ‚Äò20-‚Äò21 cohort, No Other Land continues to garner well-deserved recognition. The film captures the heart-wrenching realities of the occupation in Masafer Yatta, depicting the resilience and resistance of the Palestinian community through a compelling narrative of activism and unlikely friendship between Basel & Yuval, an Israeli political activist who wants to joins Basle's fights for justice.

üéâ Being featured at Telluride - a festival known for launching award-winning films into the global spotlight - is a monumental moment for No Other Land. We are incredibly proud of Basel, Yuval, Rachel, and Hamdan. Congratulations!

üé• Filmmaker in Focus: Samira El Mouzghibati

üé§ Samira shares her inspiring journey into filmmaking with us‚Äîfrom dreaming of starting a travel agency to discovering a passion for cinema through influential films like Crash and Volver.

‚ñ´Ô∏è Samira is the director of Les Miennes, a profound film developed during her time in the mentorship program at CloseUp, where she was a filmmaker fellow ('19-'20).

üì£ CALL FOR APPLICATIONS!

‚óªÔ∏è MacDowell is accepting applications for its Spring Summer 2025 residency program.

‚óªÔ∏è Each year, about 300 artists across seven disciplines are awarded Fellowships. There are no residency fees, and need-based stipends and travel reimbursement grants are available. Filmmakers of all backgrounds and countries are eligible.

‚è∞ Deadline: September 10, 2024, for residencies taking place between March 1 and August 31, 2025.

üîó For more information and to apply, visit www.macdowell.org/apply/apply-for-fellowship.

üìÖ Don't miss the Admissions Q&A on August 29 at 2:00 p.m. ET on Zoom.
